Posts.Content: It is not so terribly unreasonable to have the onoco give us options on are care. I went to Vanderbilt, one of the top clinics in bc cancer treatment. I had two nodes postive, they left it up to me to do A/C plus taxol or no taxol. At that time, three plus years ago there was only a few studies in and one of them in CA showed better luck without doing the taxol. I didn't do taxol, do take tamoxifen not sure after five years if I will stress my body with taking anything else. I eat very healthy, excercise, keep my weight down do not eat red meat, no dairy, no white sugar, take herbs and vitamins etc. All you can do is pray for the right answer. Linda
Posts.Title: AC+T statistics

Posts.Content: Never let anyone tell you chemo is harmless and everything will be back to normal for most of us that is not true. Aches and pains, chemo brain, heart damage. That said chemo also may save some lives, remember only 14 per cent of the onco when given a poll said they would take chemo or give it to one of their family. It also rasies heck with your immune system. I did A/C in 2002 had two postive nodes. I am 61 at present and considering our age sometimes we are treated a bit different. Sounds like Tamoxifen or one of it cousins will be necessary for you. Side effects there also which no one wants to talk about but often might be the most benefit for a lot of us. I stop taking it off and on for a few weeks and always feel better but go back on it with The What If it comes back! After five years they want to put me on another of their little pills but not sure I will go that route. It is a hard decision you have to make but yes Drs should let us decide after giving us the facts and figures. Good luck and ask the powers above for some answers. Linda
Posts.Title: Please help me decide on treatment for early stage bc!

Posts.Content: Good luck on the bras, I have about a hundred some days one is okay, next another depending on how much fluid in the breast. I have been on tamoxifen just about three years and sure seems to me my muscles and joints have ached a whole lot more then before bc. I"ll try arimidex for six months and we will see if I ache more then before I'll go back to tamoxifen or quit all of the above! I refuse to take more drugs for the drug effects from the one I am taking. There is no end to the drugs a person could take to try and stay ahead of the side effects of each one. Pray for the right thing for you. Llinda
Posts.Title: Muscle Pain almost two years after treatment

Posts.Content: Most people do not have pain after a lumpectomy, once you are through radiation most likely the pain in the breast will completely go away. Fluid in the breast is not the normal. In no way do I want anyone to think it is. Donna and I seem to be about the only ones with this problem. Just think about finishing the radiation and not worry about what will follow, one day at a time. God Bless Linda
Posts.Title: Muscle Pain almost two years after treatment

Posts.Content: Good luck on the bras, I have about a hundred some days one is okay, next another depending on how much fluid in the breast. I have been on tamoxifen just about three years and sure seems to me my muscles and joints have ached a whole lot more then before bc. I"ll try arimidex for six months and we will see if I ache more then before I'll go back to tamoxifen or quit all of the above! I refuse to take more drugs for the drug effects from the one I am taking. There is no end to the drugs a person could take to try and stay ahead of the side effects of each one. Pray for the right thing for you. Llinda

Posts.Content: Most people do not have pain after a lumpectomy, once you are through radiation most likely the pain in the breast will completely go away. Fluid in the breast is not the normal. In no way do I want anyone to think it is. Donna and I seem to be about the only ones with this problem. Just think about finishing the radiation and not worry about what will follow, one day at a time. God Bless Linda

That said chemo also may save some lives, remember only 14 per cent of the onco when given a poll said they would take chemo or give it to one of their family. That said chemo also may save some lives, remember only 14 per cent of the onco when given a poll said they would take chemo or give it to one of their family. It is a hard decision you have to make but yes Drs should let us decide after giving us the facts and figures. Good luck and ask the powers above for some answers. Linda
Posts.Title: Please help me decide on treatment for early stage bc!

Posts.Content: Outside of being much older then you we seem to have the same problems. I am 62. I just returned from a appointment with the onco who informed me that my breast will always be swollen and yes hurt in the area of the surgery. I have fluid in the breast, also a million aches and pains that come and go in different places. I started treatment in May of 2002. Four chemo, surgery and radiation. Glad to be alive needless to say and minor conpared to our sisters fighting for their lives but do wish someone had some answers. I work full time with my dogs, house, yard etc. went from tamoxifen to arimidex this past week but she said nothing would likely change with the different drug. I didn't figure it would but worth a try! Also have gained ten pounds since treatment and can't loose a pound for love nor money. Linda
Posts.Title: Muscle Pain almost two years after treatment

Posts.Content: Outside of being much older then you we seem to have the same problems. I am 62. I just returned from a appointment with the onco who informed me that my breast will always be swollen and yes hurt in the area of the surgery. I have fluid in the breast, also a million aches and pains that come and go in different places. I started treatment in May of 2002. Four chemo, surgery and radiation. Glad to be alive needless to say and minor conpared to our sisters fighting for their lives but do wish someone had some answers. I work full time with my dogs, house, yard etc. went from tamoxifen to arimidex this past week but she said nothing would likely change with the different drug. I didn't figure it would but worth a try! Also have gained ten pounds since treatment and can't loose a pound for love nor money. Linda
Posts.Title: Muscle Pain almost two years after treatment

Posts.Content: I have found years ago taking fish oil 2000 mg a day keeps my skin looking great. I live in the south and work outdoors. At 61 no crow feet and only laugh lines. I'm also a vegan but for fish, no milk, or other meat, no sugar. That is very hard as sugar in everything in the store. We also take many other vitamins and herbs. Three years since dx so hoping. Just had my four month check up Tuesday and all was okay. God Blesss Linda
Posts.Title: AlaskaAngel

Posts.Content: I have found years ago taking fish oil 2000 mg a day keeps my skin looking great. I live in the south and work outdoors. At 61 no crow feet and only laugh lines. I'm also a vegan but for fish, no milk, or other meat, no sugar. That is very hard as sugar in everything in the store. We also take many other vitamins and herbs. Three years since dx so hoping. Just had my four month check up Tuesday and all was okay. God Blesss Linda
Posts.Title: AlaskaAngel

Posts.Content: I finished radiation in Dec of 2002. I have a lump in the area of lumpectomy much larger then the tumor was. It has been there since I finished radiation. I had a ultra sound four months after radiation was finished also a mammogram. Every six months I have a mammogram. They always say I have a seroma. It is also painful, bras hurt, plus I have fluid in my breast that seems to move around. Nipple area becomes very hard after a day of work. If anyone has any idea what to do about any of this let me know. Maybe you have a seroma in the area? If so it does generally go away so they say. Check up and mammogram due next week every one worries me as I keep thinking this breast ought to settle down. I have read that sometimes it never does. Linda
Posts.Title: UPDATE Scar Tissue at Surgical Site + Mammogram

Posts.Content: What you are feeling is so very normal. The battle you have been fighting is over, you don't know if you won or not. I had two nodes positive in spring of 2002. Chose to have a lumpectomy and just four rounds of A/C. then radiaiton. I really felt my body had had enough and it was time for me to take over. Which I have, I'm a vegan but for fish once a week. No white sugar mostly organic raw foods. Sometimes if you decide to do these or differnet things you once again feel in control of your life. I do use a ND Dr and take vitamins and herbs. This of course is not for everyone but husband had prostate cancer right after I finished treatment and there is a lot of proof diet plays a large part in that cancer and bc is not to different. I take tamoxifen and those little white pills give you a pretty good chance of keeping cancer away. You have been through a lot be kind to yourself, might need a different antibotic. God Bless Linda
Posts.Title: Thank you for answers to my post on "after treatment&qu

Posts.Content: I am a great believer in herbs, diet, vitamins and my ND Dr who is great but a good ND will tell you to have surgery! After that chemo and radiation could be discussed and might not be necessary in early stage cancer. For myself I chose all three plus herbs etc. I am a vegan, no white sugar or flour and for sure no dairy. To trust in just herbs, no way. This is not the dark ages. Linda
Posts.Title: Alternative treatment or naturopathy

Posts.Content: I am a great believer in herbs, diet, vitamins and my ND Dr who is great but a good ND will tell you to have surgery! After that chemo and radiation could be discussed and might not be necessary in early stage cancer. For myself I chose all three plus herbs etc. I am a vegan, no white sugar or flour and for sure no dairy. To trust in just herbs, no way. This is not the dark ages. Linda
Posts.Title: Alternative treatment or naturopathy

Posts.Content: Don't get me wrong I have liked both of my oncos, the team at Vanderbilt was great, one of the greatest surgeon, head of the department did my lumpectomy. Dr Mark Kelly, teaching these days only. My Onco was top of the line likewise. I asked her about soy and her remark was, we don't know! I am at Sara Cannon these days due to Vanderbilt no longer taking my insurance. I was so sad to leave that great center but the bc center at Sara Cannon is likewise excellent, remember Minnie Pearl, she left all of her money for the hospital and cancer treatment in Nashville. I asked my onco there about plant estrogen, she said we know so little. We do know studies on prostate cancer show diet plays a large part in pervention and probably control of. Husband had psa of 60 advanced prostate cancer so that is where we started a long long study on diet and life style. I felt what was good for the grander might be good for the goose. By the way I had two nodes postive and a very aggressive cancer so I too don't want to mess around and take a chance on eating meat, fat, and dairy. Read Jane Plant book. I have no finicial interest in the book or anything else regarding bc. I just want Elton and I to be together many more years we have racked up 43 the first of Sept. I have no money interest in soy beans but then I don't in much of anything but I do have to pay Dr bills. Linda
Posts.Title: Folks, you can answer any medical question...

Posts.Content: Read every word you can, knowledge is power. Never believe every word a Dr tells you ask questions, and then ask more questions this is your life! I have spent in a life time a lot of time with my Mother at many different hospitals and treatment centers, she had MS and was in any program to find a cure. Some of the things they would of put her through had nothing to do with her health just a guniea pig. I had bc three years ago, at that time there was nothing to prove taxol would of done me any good, I only had A/C. Drs would of been happy to give me taxol, it is called money! I am very estrogen postive, I take tamoxifen. I also eat a lot of soy, there is no proof that plant estrogren is harmfully. I do not eat meat or any dairy I'm afraid of all of the growth hormones and the hormone to increase the milk production to say nothing of the antibotics given to livestock. I come from a farm background. Ever wonder why all young ladies these days have a D cup? Look to the chicken raising. Don't believe everything you read but don't believe everything you hear either. Linda
Posts.Title: Folks, you can answer any medical question...

Posts.Content: Yvonne. Sounds good to me but eat those fruits and vegetables not the powder stuff. I take some of what you do but also take folic acid, green tea tablets, also drink a lot of green tea. I am busy trying to train a couple pups for dog shows so the excercise issue consists of walking backward and down on my knees.
Posts.Title: Thank you for answers to my post on "after treatment&qu

Posts.Content: Dawn, Time to take a few deep breaths, talk to the good Lord and then get a grip on yourself. Many of us have had cancer, been through the treatments and all the tests and the waiting. You are not alone in worrying but this extra stress is doing absolutely no good. Read a good book, take a dip in a pool, sit in a hot tub, go see a good movie, run around the block, pet a dog, play with a kid. In general get up and get going. If I sound tough I mean to at 61 and husband of 65 both of us have had cancer and may someday deal with it again but in the mean time we are alive and living everyday to the fullest. You might get run over by a car or lighting hit you so stop worrying about what you have no control over but watch out for the car. Hugs your way. Linda
Posts.Title: any advice please

Posts.Content: I am a great believer in herbs, diet, vitamins and my ND Dr who is great but a good ND will tell you to have surgery! After that chemo and radiation could be discussed and might not be necessary in early stage cancer. For myself I chose all three plus herbs etc. I am a vegan, no white sugar or flour and for sure no dairy. To trust in just herbs, no way. This is not the dark ages. Linda
Posts.Title: Alternative treatment or naturopathy

Posts.Content: What I was referring to is if I eat healthy I won't have any Dr bills to pay hopefully! Yes we all do what we feel is right for ourselves. Read Dr Susan Love book on eating fat and dairy. We are all praying this hurricane will not take lives, my dauhter-in-law is in New Orleans after going down to attend her grand-mother funeral and unable to get out of the city. Are you no longer in northern AL? We are in TN expecting rains but nothing else. Linda
Posts.Title: Folks, you can answer any medical question...

Posts.Content: The tumor markers don't mean a lot. Some of the large cancer centers do not do them. Mine runs around 38 and has all along I am three years past dx. No one seems worried. All kinds of things make the readings off even working with rats and mice. Makes one wonder why they bother with the test. Why the fear of radiation? I am assuming you did not have a lumpectomy? Make sure you aren't passing up one more chance of a cure. Linda
Posts.Title: Need some advice on Tumor markers

Posts.Content: Dawn, Time to take a few deep breaths, talk to the good Lord and then get a grip on yourself. Many of us have had cancer, been through the treatments and all the tests and the waiting. You are not alone in worrying but this extra stress is doing absolutely no good. Read a good book, take a dip in a pool, sit in a hot tub, go see a good movie, run around the block, pet a dog, play with a kid. In general get up and get going. If I sound tough I mean to at 61 and husband of 65 both of us have had cancer and may someday deal with it again but in the mean time we are alive and living everyday to the fullest. You might get run over by a car or lighting hit you so stop worrying about what you have no control over but watch out for the car. Hugs your way. Linda
Posts.Title: any advice please

Posts.Content: I finished radiation two and a half years ago and still have swelling and breast pain. My last mammogram three weeks ago said the breast was much improved so not sure how much longer the tissue will change. Some have said up to five years other two years, not sure anyone really knows, maybe our Dr on this board can answer this question of yours. Linda
Posts.Title: breast pain

Posts.Content: Cassie, thank you so much as I am sure there is help out there. My GP has just retired and he was the most helpful of any of the Drs I have had. I have state health care and boy let me tell you they don't want to spend one penny over what they have to so it is a battle to get treatment. I will check into help as it is painful, thank heavens not all the time but riding in the car is the pits as is lifting etc. I show dogs so riding in the van and lifting are both something I do a lot of. Linda
Posts.Title: breast pain

Posts.Content: I was eleven years old fifty years ago and we were every night all summer spraying every dairy cow in the barn with DDT and often spraying ourselves to keep the flies off of us when we milked. 150 years ago there was no pesticides and cancer was almost unknown. Read Silent Spring if you can find a copy and you will see what we have done to ourselves. God Bless Linda
Posts.Title: immune cells

Posts.Content: My goodness girl do that radiation, I did chemo with a lot less odds of it being effective then they are giving you! Radiation is easy, techs are generally friendly, its fast! I had 32 a year later my husband had 42 three years down the pike we are both doing great. We are 61 and 64 and plan on being around a lot longer. You bet we all die sometime but I want to be 90 and have all the kids, grandkids and great-grandkids around to say BOY she is OLD. God Bless Linda
Posts.Title: Radiation consult results and thanks

Posts.Content: On Yahoo health news this morning there was a interesting study being done by Stanford U School of Medicene that perhaps examing the immune cells in the lymph nodes will predict the outcome of bc. New tests predict lymph nodes immune cells almost perfectly predict clinical outcome of who will need a more aggressive treatment. Is the immune system the answer to cancer? The alternative Drs have said so for years. If these folks would get their heads together maybe we would find a cure for cancer. Someday chemo will be looked at like witch oil but in the mean time might be necessary. I watched my father-in-law die of stomach cancer many years ago, he refused surgery, took chemo. Chemo did kill him the VA Dr told the family they knew he was going to die so they just thought they would see how much chemo he could stand. It was terrible thank heavens I do feel we have come a very very long way from those days. This man fought for four years overseas in world war 11 he deserved better then that. Ask questions trust no one to your health but yourself, if you are happy with your treatments go for it full steam ahead and don't look back. Eat right keep that immune system strong, be happy, angry is hard on the immune sysytem. Laugh a lot and mean it. I'm generally on CSN and we discuss many many things and keep a very open mind. Lets clean up our air, water, and soil. Remember when Isreal stopped all pesticides their cancer rate was cut in half. God Bless Linda
Posts.Title: immune cells

Posts.Content: If you are on tamoxifen or one of the drugs in that class it maybe caused by the drugs. I have had much pain since starting tamoxifen in late 2002. Just a thought, also if you are really nervous sometimes that will cause muscle pain everywhere a drug lilke xanax might help. Linda
Posts.Title: Arm and leg pain after chemo is over

Posts.Content: If you are on tamoxifen or one of the drugs in that class it maybe caused by the drugs. I have had much pain since starting tamoxifen in late 2002. Just a thought, also if you are really nervous sometimes that will cause muscle pain everywhere a drug lilke xanax might help. Linda
Posts.Title: Arm and leg pain after chemo is over

Posts.Content: If you are on tamoxifen or one of the drugs in that class it maybe caused by the drugs. I have had much pain since starting tamoxifen in late 2002. Just a thought, also if you are really nervous sometimes that will cause muscle pain everywhere a drug lilke xanax might help. Linda
Posts.Title: Arm and leg pain after chemo is over

Posts.Content: We do indeed need to look at very way of treating cancer. Lance Armstrong did many things chemo was just one. He is a mighty strong, well conditioned man my bet is his immune sysytem is tops! I wear a yellow bracklet that says Livestrong, he has the ear of the president so maybe he will raise money for finding a cure and more important why people are getting cancer at the rate we are. I also was the luck of the draw and had nine aunts so you figure! Susan Love in her book memtions we should be studing diet starting in our childhood, fats concern her. All of this needs studying not more chemo! If Lance lived because of chemo why did Jane Plants cancer come back four times, she was told nothing more could be done for her but more chemo so she could live a bit longer. She changed her diet etc and is alive many years later. I have no answers for this but we need to find a reason for cancer. The people in Africa do not have cancer but on rare occasions. Is it their diet, the fact they are backwards and don't have pesticide, excercise more, beats me but wish someone would study that also. Blessed Day Linda
Posts.Title: immune cells

Posts.Content: If at all possible go without clothes on at home, if not wear big old cotton t-shirts with of course no bra. I had burning and a lot of discharge under my breast being a bit heavy breasted. I would lay at night holding the breast up for air to the burned area, sure helped. Also put a lot of aloe vera on, if you don't have a plant you can buy the stems in most health food stores. Just cut them open and use the juice. Keep it in the refri, one stems last a long time, you will be done and healed before it is gone. Don't buy the cream as there are other things in it besides aloe. Once you are finished with radiation it heals very fast. Good Luck Linda
Posts.Title: OUCH!!

Posts.Content: Ask to go to a breast center at your nearest large city. In Nashville there are three so I'm sure any city of much size has at least one. Linda
Posts.Title: No diagnosis - but many questions

Posts.Content: Ask to go to a breast center at your nearest large city. In Nashville there are three so I'm sure any city of much size has at least one. Linda
Posts.Title: No diagnosis - but many questions

Posts.Content: Please Andrew go elsewhere, this lady needs to find out what is wrong with her if anything even related to cancer. I do believe in alternative Drs but only in relationship to proper treatment first and then go with eating and trying to excercise correctly and vitamins. It is very difficult to find a alternative Dr who is not a quack. A good alternative Dr will tell you with breast cancer surgery is a must! Please dear try not to worry to much until all tests are done. God Bless Linda
Posts.Title: questions about breast cancer, worried please help

Posts.Content: My sister and I both had these pap warts that cause bleeding from the duct. Almost always they are nothing. My sister had hers removed which I consider a very good idea. Mine was left because when I went in for the mammogram cancer was discovered in the other breast. By the time I was done with chemo etc that discharge was no longer present in three plus years it has not shown up again. The ductogram probably caused the hardness and redness. I would have it removed for peace of mind, it was not a very serious surgury my sister was home in a couple hours and back to doing her ususual work in a few days. Couldn't lift on that side for a week or so. Have it checked out I think worrying is very harmful to the body. God Bless Linda
Posts.Title: Just Concerned

Posts.Content: The radiation will not be near as long as that first appointment. I hated that day and was unprepared for it. No one told me I was going to freeze to death for a starter, nor did they explain how darn long it was going to take. Try to relax the arm as that should help. Linda
Posts.Title: Arm pain during radiation. Any helpful advice?

Posts.Content: I have had lymphdema in my breast for over two years since I finished radiation. The cancer center I go to seems to just say, yes it is a problem. I have seen bras for it which she says may do more harm then good. It is very uncomfortable plus always a reminder of where I have been. The breast is much larger most of the time so clothes don't fit right nor look very good. No one seems to have any answers for it, I cannot afford to go very far for help. Anyone who has any help for this please write. I see there are a couple of you with information on this condition. Linda
Posts.Title: lymphedema

Posts.Content: Generally a marker is put in where the tumor is at so if the chemo knocks it out they still know where to do the surgery. I had to remind my breast center after two chemos I could hardly find it. Linda
Posts.Title: Pretty new... pretty overwhelmed

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy in Sept of 2002. Once I started tamoxifen I have had pain in the breast to some degree every since. I have a great deal of fluid in that breast. Massage does help. Make sure your bra fits correctly and surport is evenly distributed. I've had several mammograms and ultra sounds everything is fine but I do know the feeling of What Next. Appointment soon again so of course the stress begins but it does get better after three years so hopefully by five years I will not stress about every appointment. Linda
Posts.Title: Pain/Tenderness at Surgery Site

Posts.Content: I have taken tamoxifen for two and a half years. At 61 some of the issues for me were less then maybe will be for you. I had been in menopause for several years. I have a great deal of bone loss and arimidex causes bone loss. I do not wish to take anymore drugs then necessary and had I taken arimidex I would need bone builder for sure. Tamoxifen at least does not cause that in fact the drug was first used to rebuild bone. I did ask about Arimidex but my onoc said after five years there still might be many things show up yet unknown about arimidex after all it takes many years for cancer to show up in different forms. In the end I decided to stick to the old tried and true tamoxifen sides effects and all. Both by the way cause a increase in blood clots. I had some hot flashes but probably no more then women my age have off and on anyhow. It is a personal decission but eating and living a healthy life style may go as far keeping us cancer free as drugs but I chose to do both at this time. Onoc said in five years she would put me on a different drug but rather sure I will past on any drugs at that time. I had two lyump nodes, lumpectomy, chemo and radiation , then tamoxifen for five years that will have to be enough unless something shows up. Good luck on whatever you decide on. Linda
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen vs Arimidex
